intro: Cephalanthera damasonium lusus ochroleuca, commonly known as the white helleborine, is a rare and protected orchid species native to parts of Europe. It is a terrestrial herb with a slender, upright stem and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, white or pale yellow flowers with a distinct lip, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in shaded, moist woodlands and requires specific soil conditions to flourish. Due to its rarity and ecological significance, it is often subject to conservation efforts.
